H0.text: The layer representing the mantle is the thinnest layer in a clay model of Earth constructed by a student.

H1.text: The layer representing the outer core is the thinnest layer in a clay model of Earth constructed by a student.

H2.text: The layer representing the inner core should be the thinnest layer in the student’s clay model of Earth.

H3.text: The layer representing the crust should be the thinnest layer in the clay model of Earth constructed by the student.

A4.text: The average thickness of the crust is about 15–20 km.
